sentences.sContent: The scientists who discovered radium did not know that it would kill them.
sentences.sContent_eng: The scientists who discovered radium did not know that it would kill them.
sentences.sCn: 那些发现了镭元素的科学家，并不知道这种元素会让他们丧命。

sentences.sContent: It is produced from radium in the decay chain of uranium, an element found in varying amounts in all rocks and soil.
sentences.sContent_eng: It is produced from radium in the decay chain of uranium, an element found in varying amounts in all rocks and soil.
sentences.sCn: 它产生于铀衰变链中的镭，而铀是所有岩石和土壤中都能找到的一种元素，含量各不相同。

sentences.sContent: Madame Curie was the physicist with expertise in chemistry that, in 1898, discovered the radioactive substances of radium and polonium in Paris, France.
sentences.sContent_eng: Madame Curie was the physicist with expertise in chemistry that, in 1898, discovered the radioactive substances of radium and polonium in Paris, France.
sentences.sCn: 居里夫人是一位具有化学专门知识的物理学家。 1898年，她在法国巴黎发现了放射性物质的镭和钋。

trans.tranOther: a white metal that is  radioactive  and is used in the treatment of diseases such as  cancer  . It is a chemical  element  : symbol Ra
